---

Arbitrum เป็น L2 ของเชน Ethereum คล้ายๆ กับ Optimism โดยมีจุดเด่นคือความเร็วและค่าธรรมเนียมที่ถูก และได้ความปลอดภัยจากความเป็น Ethereum

แคมเปญนี้ทาง Arbitrum ได้ร่วมมือกับ Project Galaxy (ดูประกาศ[ที่นี่](https://blog.galaxy.eco/project-galaxy-teams-up-for-arbitrum-odyssey-104e07edcdc9)) ในการช่วยให้คนได้รู้จักและเข้ามาใช้งานในเชนมากขึ้น โดนจะแบ่งเป็นเควสต่างๆ ตลอด 8 อาทิตย์ เมื่อจบแต่ละอาทิตย์ก็จะสามารถรับ NFT ประจำสัปดาห์ได้ โดยจะมีทั้งหมด 16 ชิ้น และ NFT 1 ชิ้นพิเศษเมื่อเราเก็บได้ครบ 13/16 ชิ้น

ธุรกรรมต้องทำในระยะเวลาที่กำหนดเท่านั้น ทำก่อนหรือหลังไม่ได้

> ถ้าอยากจะมีลุ้น Airdrop $ARB Arbitrum ก็ควรจะมีธุรกรรมมากกว่า $1,000 ขึ้นไปตลอดแคมเปญด้วย
>
> **ไม่ใช่คำแนะนำในการลงทุน - Do Your Own Research (DYOR)**


---

## ระยะเวลาแคมเปญ

22/6/2022 00:00 - 16/8/2022 23:59 ตามเวลาประเทศไทย (8 อาทิตย์)

โดยเป็นการทำธุรกรรมใน Arbitrum Ecosystem รูปแบบต่าง ๆ ที่จะค่อย ๆ ประกาศออกมาในแต่ละอาทิตย์

สามารถเช็กได้ว่าเราทำใบไหนผ่านแล้วบ้างได้ที่ [Arbitrum Odyssey x Project Galaxy Campaign Explorer](https://galaxyexplorer.stevenlei.com/arbitrum) by [@stevenkin](https://twitter.com/stevenkin)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9wkTH0iRCMkP1ZmaA-Lws.png?height=1458&width=1726)

## Week 1 - Bridge Week

22/6/2022 00:00 - 28/6/2022 23:59

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uBH6JO4kfP2CnHWbqzo0d.png?height=1274&width=2872)

![Bridge week](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/DUgsyNUcIHThvNv2v35np.jpeg?height=675&width=1200)

**ส่ง *ETH* เข้ามาที่ Arbitrum 1 ครั้ง** ขอย้ำว่า ETH เท่านั้นนะครับ โดยจะมาจากเชนไหนก็ได้ จำนวนเท่าไหร่ก็ได้  และใช้บริการจากเจ้าไหนก็ได้จากในภาพด้านบน จะได้รับ 1 NFT ตอนจบอาทิตย์ และจะมีโบนัสพิเศษถ้าเราใช้เจ้าที่มีคนมาใช้งานมากที่สุดในสัปดาห์นี้

ตอนนี้มีคนทำเครื่องมือในการมอนิเตอร์ดูว่าใครนำอยู่ เช็กล่าสุด Real-time ได้[ที่นี่](https://dune.com/springzhang/arbitrum-odyssey-event-tracking)ครับ

![As of 22/6/2022 09:15 UTC+7](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/5RSPr6i6bUKRTAPYzoeQx.png?height=804&width=1896)

เมื่อทำธุรกรรมแล้ว[เช็กได้ที่ Project Galaxy](https://galaxy.eco/arbitrum/campaign/GCCNzUtQiW)

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/fo7NaclMlSveUc9WzU0za.png?height=1394&width=2856)

### Bungee

ตัวนี้จะเป็นตัวรวบรวมบริการข้างล่างหลาย ๆ เจ้าอีกที จะช่วยหาเจ้าที่มีค่าธรรมเนียมถูกที่สุดให้ เราสามารถใช้ที่นี่แล้วเลือกเส้นทางจากเจ้าที่เราชอบได้ เช่น Hop, cBridge by Celer, Across แล้วเราก็จะได้คอมโบ้ของทั้งที่ Bungee และเจ้าที่เราเลือก

[https://www.bungee.exchange/](https://www.bungee.exchange/)

### Connext

[https://bridge.connext.network/](https://bridge.connext.network/)

### Hop

มีโปรโมชั่นแจก NFT ให้คนที่มาใช้งานด้วย [ดูรายละเอียด](https://galaxy.eco/HopProtocol/campaign/GCmydUtumN)

[https://app.hop.exchange/](https://app.hop.exchange/)

### Hashflow

มีโปรโมชั่นแจก NFT ให้คนที่มาใช้งานด้วย ซึ่ง NFT ใบนี้จะได้ Airdrop $HFT ด้วย [ดูรายละเอียด](https://blog.hashflow.com/lets-go-bridgeless-for-arbitrum-odyssey-bridge-week-d280b2afa7db)

[https://app.hashflow.com/](https://app.hashflow.com/)

### cBridge by Celer

มีโปรโมชั่นแจกรางวัลให้คนที่มาใช้งานด้วย [ดูรายละเอียด](https://twitter.com/CelerNetwork/status/1539207903797604352)

[https://cbridge.celer.network/#/transfer](https://cbridge.celer.network/#/transfer)

### Rango

มีโปรโมชั่นแจกรางวัลให้คนที่มาใช้งานด้วย [ดูรายละเอียด](https://twitter.com/RangoExchange/status/1539925646595473408)

[https://app.rango.exchange/](https://app.rango.exchange/)

### Multichain

มีโปรโมชั่นแจกรางวัลให้คนที่มาใช้งานด้วย [ดูรายละเอียด](https://twitter.com/MultichainOrg/status/1539193990204993536)

[https://app.multichain.org/#/router](https://app.multichain.org/#/router)

### Across

[https://across.to/](https://across.to/)

### deBridge

มีรางวัล NFT พิเศษ [ดูรายละเอียด](https://galaxy.eco/deBridge/campaign/GCanzUt9ru)

[https://app.debridge.finance/deswap](https://app.debridge.finance/deswap)

### DeGate

[https://bridge.degate.com/](https://bridge.degate.com/)

### Router

มีโปรโมชั่นแจกรางวัลให้คนที่มาใช้งานด้วย [ดูรายละเอียด](https://twitter.com/routerprotocol/status/1539190760855130113)

[https://app.routerprotocol.com/](https://app.routerprotocol.com/)

## สรุปผล Week 1 - Bridge Week

Hop เป็นผู้ชนะไปนะครับ ไม่ว่าจะทั้งในแง่จำนวนผู้ใช้งานและจำนวน ETH ที่ถูกส่งไป คนที่ใช้งาน Hop จะได้รับทั้งหมด 4 ใบ (ใบพิเศษยังไม่ออกมา)

<https://galaxy.eco/arbitrum/campaign/GCCNzUtQiW> <https://galaxy.eco/HopProtocol/campaign/GCmydUtumN>
<https://galaxy.eco/imToken/campaign/GCQRdUt8c7>

## Week 2 - GMX and Yield Protocol

29/6/2022 00:00 - 4/7/2022 23:59

มี 2 แพลตฟอร์มที่เข้าร่วมเพื่อเก็บสะสม 2 ใบ งานนี้กดหลายครั้งมาก ต้องเตรียมค่าแก๊สเยอะ ๆ หน่อยนะครับ แพงใช้ได้ กดครั้งละ $1 +

และยังต้องใช้เงินสดวางประมาณ $50 ถ้าใครเอาเงินสดมาไม่พอให้ส่งเงิน USDC มาจากเชนไหนก็ได้ผ่าน <https://meson.fi/> จะมีแค่ค่า Approve เหรียญ จากนั้นส่งฟรีแบบ 1:1 ดีย์งามที่สุดแล้วครับ

## GMX

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2z3AsWWHe8SIBjN9120vV.png?height=1268&width=2862)

Quest link: <https://galaxy.eco/arbitrum/campaign/GCsqgUtsTX>

> **มีงานที่ต้องทำทั้งหมด 3 งาน คือการ Swap, เทรด Future และการซื้อ GLP**

ก่อนจะทำธุรกรรมใด ๆ ที่ GMX ถ้าคุณกดต่อกระเป๋าผ่านลิ้งก์นี้ <https://gmx.io?ref=snakedao> หรือไปที่ Referral แล้วกรอกโค๊ด `snakedao` จะได้รับส่วนลดค่าธรรมเนียม 5% ในทุกธุรกรรม และถือว่าเป็นการช่วยสนับสนุนเข้า [SnakeDAO Treasury](https://debank.com/profile/0xd803589968d4dcd57a97d897693c45c8bb753b16) ด้วยครับ

![Referral code: snakedao](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/Lr_EuL7BuApFc1XwsZ51z.png?height=1276&width=2866)

1\.
ไปที่ [https://gmx.io](https://gmx.io?ref=snakedao) กดปุ่ม Trade แล้วเลือกแถบ Swap ทำการ Swap 1 ครั้ง **ขั้นต่ำ $10**

![Swap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9Im8JDXg_kKvPVwtarNKO.png?height=1514&width=2864)

2\.
ให้ทำการเปิด Long (คิดว่าราคาจะขึ้น) **หรือ** Short (คิดว่าราคาจะลง) ก็ได้ **ขั้นต่ำ $10** (มีกด Approve หลายทีกว่าจะได้เปิดสถานะจริง ๆ)

ถ้าไม่อยากเสี่ยงมากก็ให้เลือก Leverage ต่ำสุดได้ที่ 1.1x

![Open Short position](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/IZ7sXjL7B6bpi7YergEuR.png?height=1526&width=2862)

เมื่อเปิดแล้วสามารถรีบปิดสถานะ (Close) ที่กล่องด้านล่างได้เลย ถ้าไม่อยากมีความเสี่ยงต่อความผันผวนของราคา

![Close position](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mtZOXUdgdtagJOHFTNuTF.png?height=316&width=1990)

โดยเลือกปิดสถานะแบบราคาตลาด (Market) จะได้ไม่ต้องกังวลว่าจะปิดสถานะสำเร็จหรือไม่ แล้วกดจำนวน Max

![Close to Market price](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/ZHuPJEP0w0Id_LgMJfXOp.png?height=1286&width=812)

3\. ไปที่เมนู Buy แล้วเข้าไปซื้อ GLP บน Arbitrum **ขั้นต่ำ $10** หรือกดที่ลิ้งก์นี้ก็ได้ <https://gmx.io/buy_glp>

เมื่อซื้อแล้วจะถูกล็อก 15 นาทีถึงจะขายได้

![Buy GLP](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/1_ntsdQ6B2FTLwhYtSjod.png?height=1270&width=2860)

จบเควส GMX

ที่มา
<https://medium.com/@gmx.io/gmx-arbitrum-odyssey-fc12cba2d10d>
<https://galaxy.eco/credential/3254>

## Yield Protocol

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/JCTtsJGvLDF0ieyB-YV5r.png?height=1336&width=2870)

Quest link: <https://galaxy.eco/arbitrum/campaign/GCaigUt9HD>

> **มีให้เลือกทำ 3 งาน ทำแค่อย่างใดอย่างหนึ่งใน 3 งานนี้ก็พอ**

ทางเลือกที่ 1
ให้ทำการฝากลง Liquidity Pool มูลค่าขั้นต่ำ $50 <https://app.yieldprotocol.com/pool>

![Liquidity Pool](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XZ4cf4KoMMaFB6CAHa2xD.png?height=1510&width=2866)

ทางเลือกที่ 2
ไปที่เมนู Lend แล้วให้วางเงินขั้นต่ำ $50 <https://app.yieldprotocol.com/lend>

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/EZbBdgoGIb6WQjrVrg-iv.png?height=1410&width=1116)

ทางเลือกที่ 3
ไปที่เมนู Borrow <https://app.yieldprotocol.com/borrow> ให้ทำการกู้ยืมขั้นต่ำ 100 USDC โดยใช้ 120 DAI เป็นหลักทรัพย์ค้ำประกัน สามารถไป Swap USDC > DAI ได้ที่ [GMX](https://gmx.io?ref=snakedao)

![Borrow](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/cxYGiruVDgaJHOtpNV87u.png?height=1390&width=1084)

ที่ให้วาง 120 DAI สูงกว่าเงินกู้หน่อยจะได้ปลอดภัยครับ (ถ้าใช้ ETH ค้ำประกันก็จะมีความเสี่ยงสูง เพราะช่วงนี้ราคาไม่น่าไว้ใจ เกิดราคาลงไปต่ำกว่าที่กำหนดก็จะถูกยึดเงินค้ำประกันได้ครับ)

![Provide collateral](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/mjmeZtFb1uF-hGpKcnadV.png?height=1392&width=1106)

เมื่อเสร็จแล้วไปที่ Dashboard ก็จะเห็นของที่เราฝากหรือยืมทั้งหมด

รอให้เขียวก่อนค่อยกลับมาถอนออกนะครับ

![Dashboard](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/N7G51wtk7t-DkS218Jy6z.png?height=1498&width=2840)

ที่มา
<https://galaxy.eco/credential/3253>

Arbitrum เป็น L2 ของเชน Ethereum คล้ายๆ กับ Optimism โดยมีจุดเด่นคือความเร็วและค่าธรรมเนียมที่ถูก และได้ความปลอดภัยจากความเป็น Ethereum

แคมเปญนี้ทาง Arbitrum ได้ร่วมมือกับ Project Galaxy (ดูประกาศ[ที่นี่](https://blog.galaxy.eco/project-galaxy-teams-up-for-arbitrum-odyssey-104e07edcdc9)) ในการช่วยให้คนได้รู้จักและเข้ามาใช้งานในเชนมากขึ้น โดนจะแบ่งเป็นเควสต่างๆ ตลอด 8 อาทิตย์ เมื่อจบแต่ละอาทิตย์ก็จะสามารถรับ NFT ประจำสัปดาห์ได้ โดยจะมีทั้งหมด 16 ชิ้น และ NFT 1 ชิ้นพิเศษเมื่อเราเก็บได้ครบ 13/16 ชิ้น

ธุรกรรมต้องทำในระยะเวลาที่กำหนดเท่านั้น ทำก่อนหรือหลังไม่ได้

> ถ้าอยากจะมีลุ้น Airdrop $ARB Arbitrum ก็ควรจะมีธุรกรรมมากกว่า $1,000 ขึ้นไปตลอดแคมเปญด้วย
>
> **ไม่ใช่คำแนะนำในการลงทุน - Do Your Own Research (DYOR)**

title: Not another EMBRANDT Sounds Mix...
body:
I put together a mix as a celebration of the start of summer and beating my creative block 👍 haha! It’s a great feeling to be back in the sun rays and the cold air-conditioned buildings of the city. Biking around the city has been fun, too - *and* we’re just getting started. I wanted to share what I was feeling with the house music lately; this mix is a short representation of a playlist of \~60 songs. I like to take my time exploring my feeds and I add my favorite ones to a playlist. From there, I listen to the playlist as I add music and I generally get a vibe from the music I threw in there. 

Whether it’s the algorithm feeding me the vibes or my honest interpretation of all the music I hear, I hope you enjoy the sounds. 

More on how I think about my mixes below.

[https://soundcloud.com/embrandtsounds/summer-vibes-house-mix-2022](https://soundcloud.com/embrandtsounds/summer-vibes-house-mix-2022)

 1. [Deeper Purpose - Stop Trippin](https://soundcloud.com/deeperpurpose/stop-trippin)

### Mix Method-ology  |||  What’s to a mix by me?

I like to think of myself as a music curator and not a DJ. 

A DJ is someone that knows how to use a mixer to move a crowd with music they’ve made or gathered.

I’m generally not interested in DJing in front of people yet. Partly because I’m still kinda shy about it, but mostly because I like to play music *I like* for people. It’s more of a performance. We all go to festivals or shows and we take in the music they playout. Granted, the music they play is stuff they make themselves and they're all usually bangers. What matters most is the quality of the songs!

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which “you” obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon accessing reality for the first time, “you” are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, become aware of “your” existence (‘consciousness’), as well as develop an awareness of ‘thoughts’ and a procedure of thoughts (‘thinking’), achieve (some level of) control of your body and thinking (agency), and eventually learn from the environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’), which we store in our ‘memory’. The connections are a model that describes a functional i/o relation between bits (‘understanding’). Putting this all together, “we” exist as a conscious, intelligent agent of reality perceiving a sequence of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. It is almost as if reality is a Turing-Complete system (a BIG assumption) and our brains are a Turing Machine (another BIG assumption). The one thing missing in the Turing analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. The brain (our '“interpretation engine”) is unique and not well understood. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it later.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their experiences and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events that we did not personally observe (and even when we do have an experience … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, motivation, feelings, emotions, and biology) of which we may not be aware in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). Perspective is gained with an account of bias. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![A crude example of well-intentioned (perhaps) yet biased hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2dSC4WSKaPSXEgp5J1L9A.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise\*\*\*, not truth-seeking. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![Infinitism or The Absence of Evidence vs. Evidence of Absence Problem -- The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and present-day graphical renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. The evidence simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![The Gettier Problem (philosophy), Gödel’s Incompleteness Theorems (math), and Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle (science) all arrive at the same idea from different disciplines -- proof requires complete information and infinite precision. Conjecture is imminent (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt" in court.)](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. A thorough assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that everything can be explained, so the world must be deterministic. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series with Brett Hall breaking down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to have ‘creativity’ -- an ability to create new “things”. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are **[First Principles](https://fs.blog/first-principles/#_ftn11)** -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> *“What I cannot create, I do not understand”*
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root. Try the **5 Why’s method** to improve the accuracy of an explanation.

> *“Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.”*
>
> — Carl Sagan

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Again, a partially true, incomplete explanation can be sufficient if we only care about a certain level of accuracy. An explanation is measured by its explanatory power -- the degree to which an explanation accomplishes an objective. The objective can be to accurately describe Truth. Explanations have degrees of completeness based on the amount of information present in them\*\*\*\*. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. A complete explanation leaves nothing to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and 100% accurate. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as Truth (with a capital ‘T’). One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation accurately describes a fundamental Truth (a “law” of nature\*\*\*\*\*) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy and significance. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). There will always be unknowns and we do not know the significance of the unknowns. We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retrospectively describe causation and also fuel predictions -→ which builds knowledge -→ which inspires imagination -→ which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! Regardless of whether or not information is infinite\*\*\*\*\*\*, knowledge is not scarce. It is the product of intelligence and unbounded imagination and is stored in memory.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It is Truth. It just is\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. It is the purest form of objectivity (no interpretation necessary). Frankly, reality does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this realization is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change in our lives. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one theoretical exception. The only proposed natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability of the probability distribution of subatomic particles in spacetime. This gets more interesting if you consider quantum randomness in a multiplicative series of moments. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the Truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing knowledge gaps (not to be confused with information gaps). Here are two ways to reduce knowledge gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- inducing a hypothesis from experience.

2\.) explanatory methods -- deducing a cause and effect relation from imagination.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem.

Empirical methods infer an independent factor (causal inference) from observations or experimental results (statistics). This is useful to identify information gaps. You can gain (uncover) information by changing the conditions (i.e. varying the independent variable to see the change in the dependent variable). Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you may getting closer to a causal relationship (though there still may be ‘Hidden’ variables\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* which are the actual root cause). However, correlation is not causation\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* …. so … how do you know if the measured response in the ‘effect variable’ was the result of varying the ‘cause variable’ or if the independent factors are truly independent themselves? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Explanations can generate knowledge from information not apparent in the observations or statistics. An explanation can implicate an unknown factor as the root cause. The reasoning is based in ‘possibility’ vs. ‘probability’.

title: What's a 'Good' Explanation?
body:
## Look at your surroundings.

Now, explain how you ended up here.

Did your answer include the creation of existence, such as The Big Bang? If not, your answer is incomplete.

### Existence

Don’t be hard on yourself. Your explanation did not need to be 100% complete to suffice. This prompt is typically interpreted as a request for the most immediate and significant reasons for being here, such as: “I fell off my bike and broke my arm, so now I am in the ER”. For obvious reasons, it is impractical to describe The Big Bang and then every sequential moment that led to you falling off your bike. Nonetheless, let’s examine the reasons: (1) ain’t nobody got time for that. (2) any attempt at a complete explanation would be riddled with assumptions and inaccuracies. Nobody has observed every moment in spacetime, nor possesses the memory and processing capability to completely understand these events. The main point here is that there is a *reason for being* (not to be confused with purpose). The reason that ‘you’ exist is because your dad’s sperm fertilized your mom’s egg. Somewhere along the way, ‘you’ came into existence. However, the answer to the question “Why did you fall off your bike?” requires an infinitely precise answer in order to be 100% accurate (we obviously do not care about 100% accuracy in all cases, nor is 100% accuracy attainable). This is what we will explore in this post.

### Elements of the Mind

Okay, we do not care about The Big Bang when examining your current position in life. Instead, let’s view the most important part of reality -- your lifetime -- because everyone is the hero of their own story.

Let’s begin at the moment in which “you” obtain consciousness\* (ironically, a moment that nobody can remember). Upon accessing reality for the first time, “you” are immediately introduced to the **cause and effect protocol** of the universe, become aware of “your” existence (‘consciousness’), as well as develop an awareness of ‘thoughts’ and a procedure of thoughts (‘thinking’), achieve (some level of) control of your body and thinking (agency), and eventually learn from the environment (‘intelligence’, ‘cognition’, or as I like to say, ‘an ability to connect the dots’). In this case, the dots are bits of observed data (‘information’) interpreted as truth (‘knowledge’), which we store in our ‘memory’. The connections are a model that describes a functional i/o relation between bits (‘understanding’). Putting this all together, “we” exist as a conscious, intelligent agent of reality perceiving a sequence of moments (‘experience’) which we call life. It is almost as if reality is a Turing-Complete system (a BIG assumption) and our brains are a Turing Machine (another BIG assumption). The one thing missing in the Turing analogy is our ‘imagination’ -- the power to “see the unseen”. The reason that imagination is missing is because it is inconsistent with a Turing Machine, and thus makes humans extra interesting. The brain (our '“interpretation engine”) is unique and not well understood. We are also skipping the sub-conscious element of this model for now … but will definitely discuss it later.

### Trapped In The Present

The reason that we care about history is because we can learn things that may help us in the future. We start to learn the code of reality from personal observations. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their experiences and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events that we did not personally observe (and even when we do have an experience … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, motivation, feelings, emotions, and biology) of which we may not be aware in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). Perspective is gained with an account of bias. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![A crude example of well-intentioned (perhaps) yet biased hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2dSC4WSKaPSXEgp5J1L9A.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise\*\*\*, not truth-seeking. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![Infinitism or The Absence of Evidence vs. Evidence of Absence Problem -- The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and present-day graphical renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. The evidence simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![The Gettier Problem (philosophy), Gödel’s Incompleteness Theorems (math), and Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle (science) all arrive at the same idea from different disciplines -- proof requires complete information and infinite precision. Conjecture is imminent (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt" in court.)](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. A thorough assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. I highly recommend reading it. Then, we learn to communicate with others, trade ideas and inspiration with them, and trust their experiences and historical accounts of reality\*\**.* After all, we physically cannot observe *everything* ourselves. Your first conscious moment is different from my first moment, and our experiences may never overlap in any meaningful way (disregarding butterfly effects for now). We cannot recount the past with 100% certainty, especially events that we did not personally observe (and even when we do have an experience … our memory can still be fuzzy). In other words, you should keep the grain of salt in your lens. There are also complex mechanisms that influence our perception (such as assumptions, cognitive bias, motivation, feelings, emotions, and biology) of which we may not be aware in the moment (not to mention the physical limitations of our human senses). Perspective is gained with an account of bias. The famous motto from The Royal Society is pertinent here -- *Nullius in Verba* -- “take nobody’s word for it”.

![A crude example of well-intentioned (perhaps) yet biased hearsay](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/2dSC4WSKaPSXEgp5J1L9A.png?height=1945&width=2085)

A historical account is more reputable when there is evidence to corroborate it’s truth. The most influential evidence garners mass consensus of its implication (a flawed mechanism for finding truth … though it does provide a clue). There is a well known saying “wisdom of the crowd”. There is also a lesser known but equally as important saying “fatality of the mob”. Consensus provides a signal on social dynamics more than anything. The objective of consensus is to win a majority, which is all about compromise\*\*\*, not truth-seeking. There is another common phrase, “history is written by the winners”, which is not an entirely true statement in its literal translation but is an attempt to describe the common biases in historical accounting. The history textbooks are missing many individual accounts, particularly on the loser’s side. This is not all the publisher’s fault because there are typically less of the losers around after a significant historical event like war, but the missing context makes the book sensitive to a combination of conformity, misattribution, and survivorship bias.

![Infinitism or The Absence of Evidence vs. Evidence of Absence Problem -- The Ultimate Burden Of Proof](http://www.phdcomics.com/comics/archive/phd070309s.gif)

Evidence is built through discovery -- a gain of information which improves our understanding of the circumstances which produced the evidence. It is still up to humans to deduce valid conclusions from discoveries. We commonly mistake evidence as proof. Circumstantial evidence does not have the power to prove on its own. Rather, it can indicate the likelihood of a particular events’ existence, but not accurately until we drop it into context. A proper investigation entails observing each instance of history and each piece of evidence as independent from each other and then imagining the logical sequence of events to form dependencies, hence the phrase “drawing a conclusion”. Every piece of evidence or historical account has a level of faith associated with it (and we usually realize overconfidence). For example, the discovery of fossils indicates the existence of large, now-extinct beings. And we can even imagine what they looked like! However, the fossils and present-day graphical renderings do not prove dinosaurs’ existence. The evidence simply gives us a level of confidence. A different explanation for the existence of fossils could be that a scientist synthesized fossil materials in a lab and buried them to eventually claim fame once he/she later 'discovers' them and proposes a breakthrough theory of dinosaurs. However, there are sound reasons that easily disprove this explanation, namely, there is no evidence of a scientist or lab in 1677 (when Robert Plot found the first fossil) that had the capability to synthesize an organic material that could resemble the form of a fossil.

![The Gettier Problem (philosophy), Gödel’s Incompleteness Theorems (math), and Heisenberg's Uncertainty Principle (science) all arrive at the same idea from different disciplines -- proof requires complete information and infinite precision. Conjecture is imminent (we settle for "beyond a reasonable doubt" in court.)](https://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/proof.png)

Evidence is an empirical starting point. It exists in context. A thorough assessment of evidence addresses as much context as possible. At the same time, there will always be missing context, so we will never have a totally complete or perfectly accurate history. I call this *The* *Theory of Relative History*.

### Explanations

I once concluded that everything can be explained, so the world must be deterministic. I arrived at this conclusion after reading *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.amazon.com/Beginning-Infinity-Explanations-Transform-World/dp/0143121359)* by David Deutsch. I highly recommend reading it. In fact, it was the inspiration for this blog (if you don’t read books, then at least listen to Naval Ravikant’s *[The Beginning of Infinity](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jEmJIA0pEf0)* podcast series with Brett Hall breaking down the book). The big takeaway from the book is that omniscience is not required to have ‘creativity’ -- an ability to create new “things”. You do not need to know absolutely every fact that exists in order to understand everything that can be understood. Reality is most accurately described using good explanations, and there is an explanation for everything. The building blocks of explanations are **[First Principles](https://fs.blog/first-principles/#_ftn11)** -- namely the foundations of science (Relativity, Quantum, Evolution, Information, Computing, etc.) -- and the fuel is imagination.

> *“What I cannot create, I do not understand”*
>
> \-- Richard Feynman

Science is an error-correcting machine. It disproves explanations and forms better ones. You will find that the most impactful explanations require intense imagination because they describe ‘the seen’ in terms of ‘the unseen’. In other words, they describe things that cannot be observed. Unseen phenomena can be measured with special equipment, but we just observe the measurement readings on the equipment. For example, we can measure the temperature of an atom’s nucleus, but we cannot observe the movement of quarks which are the cause (we think) of the temperature reading that we observe. An explanation is not an explanation unless it is testable, falsifiable, and precisely describes a significant mechanism of change (cause and effect). It is our best guess. In this way, even good explanations are at risk of being inaccurate. This is okay because this is how we create new knowledge. A good explanation is our best understanding, our best description for how something works, at any given time. It is like the scientific method on steroids. A good explanation provides reasons and digs deep. It asks questions to get to the root. Try the **5 Why’s method** to improve the accuracy of an explanation.

> *“Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.”*
>
> — Carl Sagan

As you can see from the bike example at the beginning, an explanation does not need to be entirely complete in order to be valuable because intelligent beings (humans) can identify patterns and make inferences. Again, a partially true, incomplete explanation can be sufficient if we only care about a certain level of accuracy. An explanation is measured by its explanatory power -- the degree to which an explanation accomplishes an objective. The objective can be to accurately describe Truth. Explanations have degrees of completeness based on the amount of information present in them\*\*\*\*. A thorough explanation leaves little to chance. A complete explanation leaves nothing to chance. The pinnacle of explanations is a perfect explanation -- 100% complete and 100% accurate. The ultimate explanation, a *Theory of Everything*, would be perfect. Many people have tried to find this explanation, such as Michio Kaku's *[The God Equation](https://www.amazon.com/God-Equation-Quest-Theory-Everything/dp/0385542747)* (I have not read yet), but none have succeeded.

The jury is still out on if a perfect explanation exists.

### Truth

Our initial guess for how knowledge exists is known as the ‘justified true belief’ theory of knowledge. This theory says that knowledge is about justifying your beliefs as true. It then goes on to say that if you accomplish this, then your belief is knowledge. This a misconception because there is no logical way to prove any bit of knowledge as Truth (with a capital ‘T’). One can provide evidence, but this is not proof. If an explanation prevails against attempts to disprove it, then it is consistent with reality and is probably considered useful. Yet, we can never know with 100% certainty that the explanation accurately describes a fundamental Truth (a “law” of nature\*\*\*\*\*) because there is always a chance that we discover new knowledge debunking that explanation. Then, we simply come up with a better explanation.

The first step to finding truth is to develop a theory of knowledge (epistemology). I subscribe to the theory that knowledge is an interpretation of information that is accepted as truth and can be measured for accuracy and significance. This implies knowledge is subjective i.e. your truth may not be my truth.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/xwFu_2fyTN7kfq6Mi8bBH.png?height=792&width=1561)

In the end, knowledge is still just an assumption. Humans seek highly objective knowledge because we get rewarded with better predictions. Nassim Taleb describes a concept of *knowledge iteration* in his *[Incerto](https://www.amazon.com/Incerto-Deluxe-Randomness-Procrustes-Antifragile/dp/198481981X)* (my favorite is *[The Black Swan](https://www.amazon.com/Black-Swan-Impact-Improbable-Incerto/dp/1400063515/ref=asc_df_1400063515/?tag=hyprod-20&linkCode=df0&hvadid=312106851030&hvpos=&hvnetw=g&hvrand=11165397501409576070&hvpone=&hvptwo=&hvqmt=&hvdev=c&hvdvcmdl=&hvlocint=&hvlocphy=9010943&hvtargid=pla-330161967766&psc=1)*). There will always be unknowns and we do not know the significance of the unknowns. We don't know for sure what will effect us, kill us, or save us. It may not be real today.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kWP9k4Mb0aJLmmm6JXgSD.png?height=697&width=1114)

Explanations can retrospectively describe causation and also fuel predictions -→ which builds knowledge -→ which inspires imagination -→ which creates explanations. These ‘creations’ bring a truth into existence that did not exist before (or at least did not exist to ‘you’). It is quite liberating when you realize that explanations are created with imagination, so in theory, you can understand anything! Regardless of whether or not information is infinite\*\*\*\*\*\*, knowledge is not scarce. It is the product of intelligence and unbounded imagination and is stored in memory.

Keep in mind, reality is unbiased. It is Truth. It just is\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. It is the purest form of objectivity (no interpretation necessary). Frankly, reality does not care about you (or anything). Reality is left to humans for interpretation. The most useful application of this realization is to practice acceptance because the world is not out to get you. At the same time, we can effect change in our lives. For every effect, there is a cause\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*. For every output, there is an input. You may notice the continuity of this universal model. But what happens when there is a discontinuity in the model? And what does a gap represent?

### Randomness

The answer is randomness -- an absence of information. This is where we can assign probabilities rather than determinations of the future. The important thing here is that reality is not intrinsically random or uncertain … with one theoretical exception. The only proposed natural randomness in the universe is the phenomena described by quantum mechanics -- an explanation for how matter and energy behaves as spacetime approaches zero. Even in quantum, we have some predictive ability of the probability distribution of subatomic particles in spacetime. This gets more interesting if you consider quantum randomness in a multiplicative series of moments. As you can see, each sequential moment gets increasingly difficult to predict and eventually the complexity explodes, leading most scientists to chaos theory and the multiverse\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*.

All other probability is subject to a knowledge base. This means that any likelihood which we attributed to an event’s existence is a function of our ignorance. When humans say “I am uncertain”, we are admitting that we do not know a critical piece of information that would make the Truth apparent. We can reduce uncertainty and increase the accuracy of our predictions by reducing knowledge gaps (not to be confused with information gaps). Here are two ways to reduce knowledge gaps and improve predictability:

1\.) empirical methods -- inducing a hypothesis from experience.

2\.) explanatory methods -- deducing a cause and effect relation from imagination.

These methods are most powerful when deployed in tandem.

Empirical methods infer an independent factor (causal inference) from observations or experimental results (statistics). This is useful to identify information gaps. You can gain (uncover) information by changing the conditions (i.e. varying the independent variable to see the change in the dependent variable). Here’s a hint, when correlations between events approach 100%, you may getting closer to a causal relationship (though there still may be ‘Hidden’ variables\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* which are the actual root cause). However, correlation is not causation\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* …. so … how do you know if the measured response in the ‘effect variable’ was the result of varying the ‘cause variable’ or if the independent factors are truly independent themselves? Enter explanations.

This is how explanatory methods save the day. Explanations can generate knowledge from information not apparent in the observations or statistics. An explanation can implicate an unknown factor as the root cause. The reasoning is based in ‘possibility’ vs. ‘probability’.

I suggest watching Vsauce's YouTube video: "[What is Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)" and Veritasium’s sister episode: "[What is Not Random](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)" to further explore randomness as a property of ignorance.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9rIy0xY99a0)

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sMb00lz-IfE)

To quickly make better predictions, acquire fundamental knowledge. Search for the fundamental factors of reality, the ones with high explanatory power. Lean on *First Principles* thinking or even better -- [Zeroth-Principles Thinking](https://medium.com/future-literacy/zeroth-principles-thinking-9376d0b7e7f5). After all, explanations are the best way to hunt the Truth. On the other hand, we will always have to make decisions with incomplete information, and thus are exposed to uncertainty … so get used to it!

I glossed over the fact that “meaning” is an important part of the brain’s interpretation engine. Sooo … what is meaning? Is meaning created or intrinsic to reality? If we assume that reality is deterministic, then can meaning exist or can we have free will? Can there be a meaning of life? If we assume that life has meaning, then what is the meaning? My best answer right now: the meaning of life is to create value. More on that in the next post…

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*

\*I assume ownership of consciousness for the sake of understanding; rather, consciousness spontaneously “exists” without an agent or precise initial moment and is “you”. I enjoyed Brett Hall’s view of [ontology](https://www.bretthall.org/blog) --an explanation of being--what does it mean to exist. The model that I describe requires a definition for the concept of “you” (a whole exercise itself). I use a version of “you” that is a figment of the brain and represents an identity. “You” is awareness that exists as a state of consciousness. I also enjoyed Evan Conrad’s [article](https://evanjconrad.com/posts/how-to-feel-good) which offers a view that “you” are not your “thoughts” and suggests practical applications of this knowledge. “You” observe thoughts. At the same time, you have agency of thinking in the sense that you may be aware of a thought or feelings and its relation to “you” (as an identity that has control of an interpretation engine which does thinking procedures and serves the next thought). I would like to add that you are not your feelings. In Conrad’s view, both thoughts and feelings are real “to” you, rather than “are” or “of” you.

\*\*Yes, trust in fellow humans is risky, but the payoffs have historically outweighed the costs. There are concepts of infinite games in Game Theory which incentivize cooperation in most instances.

\*\*\*We will explore the mechanisms of consensus in another post.

\*\*\*\*Completeness is a function of access and precision. Explanations are incomplete when they are missing info. This is almost always the case when expressing explanations in spoken language because language itself is imprecise. A good question: can we know all information?

\*\*\*\*\* When describing physical reality, there is no such thing as a “law of nature” or Truth (with a capital ‘T’) since the description exists in the abstract realm of knowledge. There are just REALLY good explanations (called theories in science) that may resemble physical Truth because of their accuracy in describing and predicting phenomena, but we would never know for certain. However, there is a Truth. It exists and exists as reality. This implies the existence of False (with a capital ‘F’). Knowledge is abstract thought -- an interpretation of information which exists relative to reality (Truth/False) -- and can actually be True or False when describing knowledge, but not reality.

\*\*\*\*\*\*The more important and deeper question is whether reality is continuous or discrete. This question is most famously illustrated via [Zeno’s Paradox](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zeno%27s_paradoxes). Modern science does not even have a consensus on this answer. I think the answer requires a better understanding of time and information. Is information a property of reality? Does reality exist as a state of information at (that changes changes between?) moments of time? Can we create new “things” (real or abstract)? Does the set of information (as elements) grow, accumulate, remain static, or simply change?

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*I suppose the ultimate truth is whether reality itself exists or not.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*We may explore whether the inverse is necessarily true, which requires a consideration of infinity. If reality is a relation mapping moments to moments, which [type](https://t-redactyl.io/blog/2021/03/types-of-functions-injective-surjective-and-bijective.html) of relation is it? Also, what happens when you consider time (the temporal relationship between cause and effect)? In logic, a concept of time is unnecessary.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*We may address these concepts at some point. We perceive time as a sequence of moments (maybe a series when considering our memory), but time may not actually “be” a sequence of moments. We do not have access to all of reality (information), which leads to gaps in information and knowledge (understanding). Also, knowledge lags information. The Truth Spectrum is not to be confused with true vs. false in logic. It is more closely related to the concept of [entropy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entropy_(information_theory)) in Information Theory.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*A change in the dependent variable (effect) may be caused by an unaccounted or unknown factor (cause) rather than the independent factor. This may be “confounding'“ to some. Others say Hidden variables, once identified in an experiment, are “extraneous” if they think they can be controlled. It is hard to control variables (especially unknown ones) in experiments, and physical experiments are temporal in nature.

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*Correlation is an association between sets, not a function. Causality is a function of sorts.

PS: I promise future blogs will not be this long.

title: 唯易报｜6.29快讯
body:
## 1. 报告：三箭资本类似老式的麦道夫式庞氏骗局

研究公司FSInsight近日在一份研究三箭资本内爆影响的报告中表示，最近几周，加密行业被一个“老式的麦道夫（Madoff）式庞氏骗局”“击垮”。Bernie Madoff是美国金融家，他曾运作美国历史上最大的庞氏骗局。 

FSInsight数字资产策略主管Sean Farrell在报告中写道，三箭创始人Su Zhu和Kyle Davies利用自己的声誉“鲁莽地从该行业的几乎所有机构借贷机构借款”，导致包括Voyager Digital、Babel Finance和BlockFi在内的一些业内知名公司受到连锁影响。 

报告称，三箭的资产管理规模在峰值时超过180亿美元。但考虑到目前已知贷给该公司的债务规模，尚不清楚有多少实际股本面临风险。报告还称，Su Zhu和Kyle Davies很可能只是“利用借来的资金来偿还贷款机构发放贷款的利息，同时‘篡改账目’，以显示巨额的资本回报”。 

根据Farrell的说法，考虑到Voyager Digital和BlockFi等公司对该基金的敞口规模，似乎三箭的绝大多数资产都是用债务购买的，其抵押比率非常小。 

此外，FSInsight表示，近期数据显示比特币持有者纷纷投降，但矿企头寸的增加仍有可能成为进一步抛售压力的来源。它补充说，尽管数字资产价格的短期前景仍然“不稳定”，但市场已经达到了比特币深度价值，长期投资者应该加以利用。（CoinDesk）

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6ENTVuhB_ur1Jh0KvH2ua.png?height=200&width=600)

## 2. Tether（USDT）计划成为首个对其储备进行审计的稳定币

据官方消息，Tether表示目前正准备接受一家大型会计师事务所的审计，该事务所是“12大”会计师事务所之一。Tether计划成为第一个对其储备进行审计的稳定币，预计其他稳定币将一如既往地追随Tether的脚步。 

此外，目前USDT储备的47%以上是美国国债，而商业票据只占不到25%。其目前的商业票据投资组合已经进一步减少到110亿美元（2022年第一季度末为200亿美元），到2022年6月底将下降至84亿美元，并会逐渐减少到零，而不会发生任何损失。所有商业票据都将到期，并将被纳入短期美国国债。 

批评人士指出，自5月份以来，Tether已经处理了超过140亿美元的赎回。然而，这是对USDT实力和Tether储备质量的基本证明。最值得注意的是，Tether在10天内处理的总资产比例比华盛顿互惠银行（Washington Mutual）破产前处理的资产比例更高。 

而对于近期遭到DDoS攻击，Tether表示，这永远不会对USDT的稳定性、流动性或可赎回性产生任何影响。

USD永续合约、现货卖空等工具，寻求制造足够大的压力，导致大量资金流出，损害USDT流动性，最终以更低的价格回购代币。在过去几个月/几年里，这些对冲基金相信并帮助传播各种FUD。 

尽管有公开的第三方证明，Tether与监管机构合作、Tether提高透明度的举措等，他们一直认为并暗示Tether是坏人。但正如此前常说的那样，Tether拥有>=100%的储备支持，赎回从未失败过，所有USDT都以1美元的价格赎回。在48小时内，Tether处理70亿的赎回操作，平均占其总资产的10%，这几乎是银行机构都不可能做到的。 

在一个多月的时间里，Tether处理160亿的赎回操作（约占总储备的19%），再次证明Tether的运营、投资组合、银行基础设施和团队都是可靠的，经过了实战考验。USDT是唯一在极端压力下被证明具有实力的稳定币。 

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/9IWVnt0SQhrmDfJ5pgp9M.png?height=297&width=1043)

唯易WitEx.io是一家业务丰富的数字资产公司，主要包含交易所、资产管理以及挖矿三大业务，均与业内头部公司保持深度合作关系。

唯易WitEx.io是首家OKX Cloud合作交易平台，主要面向全球用户提供比特币、莱特币、以太币等数字资产的币币和衍生品交易服务。同时，WitEx.io共享OKX的账户安全体系、身份认证体系以及世界顶尖的撮合引擎和交易深度，独享世界最低的现货吃单手续费，为用户带来稳定、极致的交易体验。

**（6.27）本周NFT热点一览：The other side将于7月16日开启第一次旅行！**

LooksRare带你看一周NFT热点项目！

**The other side**

6月28日，无聊猿宇宙the other side 官方推特发布消息，7月16日将开展第一次旅行，号召土地持有人前往官方Discord参与调查，调查持续48小时。受到该消息刺激，the other side土地地板价格超过了3ETH，24小时交易额上涨40%，位列第一。

 Doodles**

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/alGiVQsX5-qFxmMyfbKb4.png?height=644&width=910)

**GODA**

GODA是一个艺术品NFT平台，旨在与传统艺术家在数字艺术空间中进行密切合作，帮助他们以一种有机且真实的方式利用NFT新媒体来表达他们的创作声音。GODA作为平台产品的MINTPASS，可以获得后续平台发行作品的空投，合计1000份。

title: Not another EMBRANDT Sounds Mix...
body:
I put together a mix as a celebration of the start of summer and beating my creative block 👍 haha! It’s a great feeling to be back in the sun rays and the cold air-conditioned buildings of the city. Biking around the city has been fun, too - *and* we’re just getting started. I wanted to share what I was feeling with the house music lately; this mix is a short representation of a playlist of \~60 songs. I like to take my time exploring my feeds and I add my favorite ones to a playlist. From there, I listen to the playlist as I add music and I generally get a vibe from the music I threw in there. 

Whether it’s the algorithm feeding me the vibes or my honest interpretation of all the music I hear, I hope you enjoy the sounds. 

More on how I think about my mixes below.

[https://soundcloud.com/embrandtsounds/summer-vibes-house-mix-2022](https://soundcloud.com/embrandtsounds/summer-vibes-house-mix-2022)

Tracklist: Artist - Song

 1. [Deeper Purpose - Stop Trippin](https://soundcloud.com/deeperpurpose/stop-trippin)
 2. [Sliipow - Flashion](https://soundcloud.com/terminalunderground/flashion)
 3. [Born DIrty - Kiss](https://soundcloud.com/borndirtymusic/kiss-way-way-records)
 4. [Gustavo Koch - In Da Ghetto](https://soundcloud.com/housixrecords/gustavo-koch-in-da-ghetto-hsx004)
 5. [KZN - THE CLUB](https://soundcloud.com/blackartelrec/kzn-the-club)
 6. [Mochakk - Early Synths](https://soundcloud.com/mochakkmusic/mochakk-early-synths)
 7. [Taiki Nulight - Ugly Truth](https://soundcloud.com/confession/taiki-nulight-ugly-truth)
 8. [Twista - Overnight Celebrity (Qlank Remix)](https://soundcloud.com/qlank/twista-overnight-celebrity-qlank-remix)
 9. [Twogangs - Turma](https://soundcloud.com/goodtimesaheadmusic/twogangs-turma)
10. [Victor Cardenas & Meluchis - Boom Pa-Ra (Extended Mix)](https://soundcloud.com/fightclvb/boom-pa-ra)
11. [Doja Cat - Kiss Me Moreft. SZA (Gabe Ruth Rework)](https://soundcloud.com/gaberuthau/doja-cat-kiss-me-more-ft-sza-gabe-ruth-rework)
12. [Nicche - Metro](https://soundcloud.com/nicchefm/nicche-metroo)
13. [Buogo - Free](https://soundcloud.com/houseofhustle/hls339-buogo-free-original-mix)
14. [Destiny’s Child - Lose My Breath (Alex Chapman House Edit)](https://soundcloud.com/alexchapman1/lose-my-breath-alex-chapman-edit)
15. [SNBRN - DMs ft. 1993, Lucati](https://soundcloud.com/snbrn/dms-feat-1993) 
16. [Kyle Walker - All You Need (Extended Mix)](https://soundcloud.com/kylewalkersongs/all-you-need-extended-mix)
17. [Endor - Heavyweight](https://soundcloud.com/endortracksuk/heavyweight)

### Mix Method-ology  |||  What’s to a mix by me?

I like to think of myself as a music curator and not a DJ. 

A DJ is someone that knows how to use a mixer to move a crowd with music they’ve made or gathered.

I’m generally not interested in DJing in front of people (…yet. I’m on the path to convincing myself to do it). Partly because I’m still kinda shy about it, but mostly because I like to play music *I like* for people. 

It’s more of a performance. 

We all go to festivals or shows and we take in the music they play out. Granted, the music they play is stuff they make themselves and they're all usually bangers. What matters most, from my perspective, is the quality of the music they play and less about how they mix it. 

In my quest to make a mix, I prioritize the diversity of sounds and bass over everything. Songs nowadays are getting creative in their intros/outros/breakdowns; I use this idea to let me bypass getting too deep into effects. In my process, I focus on finding the sounds and letting them come together.  

Enough ideology. 

How do I find music? I follow a ton of people on [SoundCloud](https://soundcloud.com/embrandtsounds/following) so my feed is all over the place with different genres and tunes a day. I can press play and I trust I’ll hear a good song at least once every 3-5 songs. 

What do I do when I find a song I like? There’s three options: like, repost, playlist. A like means “this song is good.” It might not be something unique, but it’s sounds good and I enjoyed hearing it. Any good song I hear is at least liked. I’ll repost a track w

Over the past few months, we've shipped:

* [A decentralized publishing protocol](https://dev.mirror.xyz/J1RD6UQQbdmpCoXvWnuGIfe7WmrbVRdff5EqegO1RjI)

title: 下次牛市，公链是否还是主要轮换叙事？
body:
*撰写：Rektdiomedes*

*编译：TechFlow intern*

上一次牛市绝对是由 L1 和“L1 板块轮动”主导的，但未来会是这样吗？

![5a2cb031a2592f500987849e4219ca1.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/05dbd766a08d96aa0f9a3f78c92ad373.png)

我们都记得2021年发生了什么......所有的L1绝对主导了涨幅榜，估值增长远远超过数百亿......

如果我没记错的话，我们一度有ETH、BNB、LUNA、SOL、ADA、DOT和AVAX都在市值前十的代币中，MATIC和NEAR紧随其后。(可怜的Fantom)

![8b031fb1d87bfa3aa6855e31cab9066.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/a6f01c70c55dbee09db428ff88fce4ab.png)

那么为什么这些代币能够获得如此高的估值呢？ 我的想法是：

**1) 脱胎于 $ETH 证明的“模型”**

**2）每个人都选择了L1 竞赛的“赢家”**

**3）机构资本首选数字投资类型**

**4）3AC（非讽刺）**

在 L1（和 L2 的）赛季结束后，我们看到了 L1：

**BNB>Polygon>Fantom>Avax>Luna>Metis>......**

这些协议背后的基础也用大量的美元来激励 TVL（并不是说这是一个错误的选择，只能说它是一个重要的变量）。

另外，上面提到的相对估值高的一部分加密货币，几乎都是基础层代币，因为在它们之上并没有真正的“协议”，但这种情况会继续吗？

毫无疑问，L1 肯定会非常重要，因为它们提供了数字经济的商品（区块空间）。问题是这种商品有多“稀缺”？

我的看法是，它目前并不稀缺，因为现在有很多不同的 L1 竞相提供它。在某种程度上，通过较小的交易费用和经济激励，它变成了“比烂游戏”，就像大麻在美国合法化时发生的事情一样。我住在最早将大麻合法化的州之一，我记得当它发生时，每个街区都有不同的药房，所有这些都是由大麻爱好者开办的，他们认为这是他们发财的机会。

然而，这些人很快就开始卷起来了，因为他们（以及种植大麻的公司）都不得不不断降低价格以相互竞争，从而降低利润，人们基本上看到了大麻行业的 "沃尔玛化"，L1/L2 的世界似乎很可能差不多。（尽管从技术上讲它仍然是一个非常重要且引人入胜的主题，尤其是：扩展解决方案）

![92beb0cb2651279a0c122b70f244e20.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/fccbf18a0d7dc08ad542a4e3b6b33370.png)

所以......我可能是错的，**但在我看来，下一个牛市更有可能由协议来定义，并且可能与链无关**。这将会是什么样子？我认为我们已经可以从几个方面看到它的一些端倪...

1）一些大型协议将会出现在很多链上，正如我们看到的Aave和Curve那样

2) L1将疯狂地竞争，以吸引有价值的协议。

3）更多的跨链互操作

4）协议将以另一种方式建立自己的“链”

5）我们将看到那些继续朝着合法化的、具有有机现金流的、不依赖链服务的协议发展，如 $BIFI、$GMX、$GNS、NFT 市场等

6）我们可能会看到（与链无关的）稳定币继续在加密货币中获得市场份额，因为它们似乎构成了迄今为止最具粘性的“用例”，即使牛市恢复，也可能占据前 10 名

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/3IUcjGCfzFJUUDKhDe3bw.png?height=731&width=739)

综上所述，**认为未来与链无关的想法，是所有这些跨链桥灾难，就像 Harmony 发生的那样**。然而，似乎这个问题将以某种方式得到解决，因为很明显，为了避免令人望而却步的交易成本，扩展解决方案是必要的。

**Gamefi/NFT/X2E/手机等较新的垂直行业似乎也很有可能成为加密货币越来越大的一部分，进一步取代 L1 作为该领域资本主要受益者的地位**。

![63f206f99525cb76462b52028fce317.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/b749263d7e138ec0d662988934b59b90.png)

无论如何，我可能完全错了，而且我有很多的$ETH和一小部分$FTM与$AVAX，所以我当然不希望L1的估值归零或什么的，但似乎下一个牛市可能会看到一个非常不同的前10名。

![54b3607f3ee5bf2e99c37239d246c13.png](https://www.techflow520.com/uploads/2022/06/28/8e7575489bb185fcab12ffd35bcbd11a.png)

title: A quick intro to Ethereum
body:
## What is Ethereum?

Ethereum is a technology that's home to digital money, global payments, and applications. It provides:

* Banking for anyone - no frontiers to do payments, borrow money, lend money, etc.
* Censorship resistant - no government or company has control over Ethereum
* Private internet - no need to provide your personal details to use Ethereum Apps
* Peer-to-peer - move money, or make agreements, directly with someone else. No need to go through intermediaries
* Decentralized - anyone can learn, earn, use and contribute to Ethereum. The network is run by independent contributors from all around the world

## Key Concepts

* Ethereum network is powered with it’s currency **ETH**
* Your funds are stored in **addresses** (public keys) in Ethereum, similarly to a bank account.
* You get access to your funds through the use of **private keys**, think of it as a super secure password, one private key per address.
* You can have **wallets** that store many addresses (“bank accounts”) and private keys (“passwords”) so it allows you to approve payments through the wallet.

## What is a Smart Contract?

A "smart contract" is simply a program that runs on the Ethereum blockchain.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/a-jr3_hELrtW4DSMbo1X3.png?height=628&width=1200)

Imagine you have a complex transaction involving significant money. (i.e. a bet on a basketball team). You would need to go to a lawyer to set up an escrow account, pay them, and wait while they do the work and ensure the contract terms are satisfied (i.e. the match is done). Only once your lawyer has done the work to ensure everything is executed correctly  will you get the document/goods/money, etc.

One of the biggest problems with this traditional approach is the need for trusted individuals to follow through with the contract's outcomes. 

Smart contracts digitize agreements by turning the terms of an agreement into computer code that automatically executes when the contract terms are met.

## Examples of Smart Contracts

You can use smart contracts for all sorts of situations ranging from: financial derivatives, insurance premiums, breach contracts, property law, credit enforcement, financial services, legal processes, crowdfunding agreements.

### Real Estate

Suppose you rent an apartment from me. You can do this through the blockchain by paying in [cryptocurrency](https://blockgeeks.com/guides/what-is-cryptocurrency-everything-you-need-to-know-ultimate-guide/). We can 

.

.

.

.

.

### DeFi Applications:

Smart contracts in DeFi are facilitating the exchange of goods, services, data, funds and so on. Users of centralized financial institutions, such as banks and credit unions, rely on intermediaries to execute a transaction. Whereas, DApps are using smart contracts to ensure that each action is genuine, transparent, and free of human error.

### Democracy

There are many voting systems proposal that leverage the blockchain capability to track everone’s votes. With their secret key/identity, anyone can vote only once as per the smart contract. . There is no need to recount votes, validate late comins or wait for the final outcome, once the voting time is over: there’s a new winner!

Insiders vouch that it is extremely hard for our voting system to be rigged, but nonetheless, smart contracts would allay all concerns by providing an infinitely more secure system. Ledger-protected votes would need to be decoded and require excessive computing power to access. No one has that much computing power, so it would need God to hack the system!

Secondly, smart contracts could hike low voter turnout. Much of the inertia comes from a fumbling system that includes lining up, showing your identity, and completing forms. With smart contracts, volunteers can transfer voting online and millennials will turn out en masse to vote for their POTUS.

title: สรุป AMA SubQuery x ContributionDAO
body:
ในวันที่ 4 เมษายน ทางทีมงาน Contribution DAO ได้มีโอกาสจัด AMA ร่วมกับโปรเจค Polkadot ชื่อดังอย่าง SubQuery โดยใน AMA นี้เราจะได้คุยกับ James Bayly ผู้เป็น Head of BD ของตัวโปรเจค SubQuery นั่นเองครับ ในบทความนี้เราจะมาสรุป AMA เพื่อให้ทุกคนได้ร่วมอ่านและทำความเข้าใจเกี่ยวกับตัวโปรเจค SubQuery กันครับ

สามารถรับชมวีดีโอเต็มได้[ที่นี่](https://www.facebook.com/contributiondao/videos/933034400719515/)

## SubQuery คืออะไร? และอะไรคือปัญหาที่ SubQuery ต้องการที่จะแก้?

ปัญหาเริ่มมาจากการที่เวลาเราจะเริ่มสร้าง Application สมมุติว่าเราต้องการที่จะจ่ายเงินหรือต้องการที่จะเก็บข้อมูลต่างๆ เราสามารถดึงข้อมูลออกมาได้ง่าย เพราะข้อมูลที่เราเก็บไว้ใน Application ของ Web 2.0 นั่นถูกออกแบบมาให้จัดเก็บง่าย เช่น SQL mongodb หรืออื่นๆ แต่ในทางกลับกัน ถ้าเราพูดถึง Web 3.0 เราก็จะต้องการให้ข้อมูลเหล่านี้มาทำให้ application นั้นใช้งานได้เช่นเดียวกัน ตัวอย่างเช่น Wallet เราล้วนต้องการข้อมูลในอดีตหรือต้องการดึงข้อมูลที่เฉพาะเจาะจงบางช่วงเวลามาเพื่อใช้พัฒนา Application

อย่างไรก็ตาม Blockchain นั้นไม่ได้ถูกออกแบบมาเพื่อให้ดึงข้อมูลได้ง่ายเหมือน SQL หรือ mongodb เพราะใน Blockchain นั้นจะเป็นข้อมูลที่เป็น chain ของ block ในลักษณะที่จะเป็น block ต่อกันไปเรื่อยๆเกิดเป็น chain ขึ้นมา  สมมุติว่า ถ้าเราต้องการจะดึงข้อมูลย้อนหลัง 1 ปี ถ้าเราไม่มีเครื่องมือที่ช่วยในการค้นหา เราต้องทำการค้นหาที่ละ block เพื่อให้ได้ข้อมูลที่ต้องการ ซึ่งจะทำให้ การประมวลการในการดึงข้อมูลช้า เพราะไม่มีเครื่องมือที่ถูกออกแบบมาเพื่อปัญหานี้

SubQuery ได้ออกแบบมาเพื่อแก้ปัญหานี้ โดยที่ SubQuery นั้นจะเปรียบเสมือนกระดูกสันหลังของ Dapps บน Polkadot เลยก็ว่าได้ เพราะ SubQuery นั้นจะทำการดึงข้อมูลจาก Blockchain มาให้ Application ต่างๆได้ใช้งานได้ง่าย เช่น ใน Blockchain อาจจะเก็บว่าใครโอนเงินไปให้ใคร SunQuery จะไม่ได้ดึงข้อมูลเพียงอย่างเดียวแต่จะทำการ transform ข้อมูลนั้นๆให้เป็นไปตามในลักษณะที่ Application ต้องการได้

## Onfinality กับ Subquery เกี่ยวข้องหรือต่างกันยังไง?

Onfinality นั้นเป็นบริษัทแรกเริ่มก่อนที่จะมี SubQuery เกิดขึ้น และเป็น Infrastructure provider ให้กับ Polkadot หรือถ้าเปรียบกับ Ethereum ก็จะเป็นเหมือน infura/alchemy ที่เป็น Infrastucture เช่นกัน ซึ่ง Onfianlity ก็ทำแบบนั้นเช่นเดียวกันโดยที่ Onfinality ได้สร้างบริษัทที่แยกออกมาเพื่อแก้ในอีกปัญหานึงซึ่งก็คือการ index การ Query ข้อมูลของ Blockchain ก็เลยออกมาเป็น Subquery

## รายได้ของ SubQuery มาจากไหน?

ทาง SubQuery จะเปิดตัว mainnet server และให้ service ต่างๆให้กับโปรเจค สำหรับโปรเจคเล็กๆ ก็อาจจะไม่ต้องเสียอะไร แต่เมื่อไหร่ก็ตามที่เป็นโปรเจคที่ใหญ่มากขึ้น ก็อาจจะต้องมีการเก็บค่า fees ที่ต้องจ่ายให้ทาง SubQuery ด้วยเช่นกันเนื่องจากต้องใช้ resource ที่มากขึ้น นอกจากนี้ยังมีตัว mainnet ซึ่งจะทำหน้าที่ Query data และก็จะมี indexer ที่จะทำการดึงข้อมูลจาก Blockchain มาให้กับลูกค้า (มีหน้าที่เป็น server provider) ค่าใช้จ่ายที่เราไม่ต้องจ่ายในการรัน server เราก็จะไปจ่ายให้กับทาง indexer แทน

## Indexer คืออะไร?

Indexer เป็นเหมือนคนที่จะรัน server เพื่อที่จะคอยเก็บข้อมูลในลักษณะที่เราต้องการ Indexer ก็จะคอยรันข้อมูล คอยเก็บข้อมูลต่างๆ ไว้ใน data base โดยแทนที่เราจะรันเอง เราสามารถดึงข้อมูลจาก Indexer แทน โดยเราไม่ต้องทำการดึงข้อมูลจากคอมพิวเตอร์ของเราเอง นี่ก็เป็นการประหยัดทรัพยากรของเราไปด้วย

Indexer สามารถเปรียบเสมือน node ที่อยู่บน network แต่ถ้าเราเปรียบเทียบกับ Validator node มีหน้าที่ยืนยันธุรกรรม แต่ Indexer จะไม่ได้แค่ยืนยันธุรกรรมอย่างเดียวแต่จะทำการยืนยันความถูกต้องของข้อมูลและส่งมอบข้อมูลนั้นให้เค้าผู้ใช้งานที่ทำการขอข้อมูลมา

## ทำไม SubQuery ถึงเลือก Polkadot?

สาเหตุที่เลือก Polkadot เพราะว่า Polkadot นั้นเป็นสิ่งที่ทางทีมได้คุ้นเคย และทาง Subquery ได้มองไปถึงเรื่อง Multichain ซึ่งในอนาคตจะทำการขยายไปอีกหลาย chains และการที่ Subquery จะไปถึงจุดมุ่งหมายนั้นได้ เนื่องจาก Polkadot สามารถสื่อสารกับหลายๆ chain ได้ เป็นเหมือนกับ parachain การที่เราเชื่อมต่อกับ Polkadot สามารถทำให้เราสื่อสารกับ chain อื่นๆได้อีกด้วยซึ่งสิ่งนี้ก็ทำให้ตอบโจทย์ในเรื่องของ Multichain

ในเมื่อไม่นานมานี้ทาง Subquery ได้เชื่อมกับ Avalanche ซึ่งเป็นโปรเจคที่จะมี Sub network ที่จะมี chain ย่อยๆไปอีก ซึ่งก็จะคล้ายกับ Polkadot และเป็น Chain ที่พึ่งเกิดมาได้ไม่นานและเป็นโปรเจคที่น่าจับตามองอีกด้วย

## SubQuery กับ The graph ต่างกันยังไง?

The graph นั้นได้ถูกออกแบบมานานแล้ว ซึ่งแก้ปัญหาเดียวกันกับ SubQuery แต่จะโฟกัสไปที่ Ethereum หรือ EVM base chain เช่น Ethereum ในขณะเดียวกันสื่งที่ SubQuery โฟกัสนั้นคือ Polkadot กับ non-EVM chain แต่ในลักษณะการดีไซน์หรือการใช้งานต่างๆ SubQuery จะค่อนข้างต่างจาก The graph ตรงที่ว่า The graph จะมี Curator ที่คอยบอกว่า ควรจะโฟกัสความต้องการของโปรเจคที่ตรงไหน และโปรเจคที่เกิดขึ้นมาใหม่จะมี Curator ที่คอยจัดการในส่วนของตรงนี้

ทาง Subquery ได้นำเอาบาง design ของ The graph มาพัฒนาแต่ได้เห็นว่าทาง Curator นั้นไม่จำเป็น เพราะเราสามารถจัดการ demand ด้วยลักษณะอื่นได้ ดังนั้นใน Subquery ก็จะไม่มีตัว Curator จะมีแค่ indexer ก็จะทำให้การใช้งานง่ายขึ้น แต่ในขณะเดียวกันก็จะมีสิ่งที่เหมือนกันคือ conventionของการเขียน code เพราะการดีไซน์ของ Subquery จะเหมือนกับ The graph เช่นในรูปแบบการเขียน Schema ก็จะใช้ GraphQL เหมือนกัน ทำให้ developer ที่เคยใช้งาน The graph สามารถใช้งาน Subquery ได้เหมือนกัน

## ตัวอย่างของโปรเจคที่ SubQuery ช่วยทำให้สำเร็จ

Moonbeam ได้ร่วมงานกับ SubQuery และทาง Moonbeam ได้บอกมาว่าการที่มี SubQuery นั้นช่วยให้การ develop ของเค้านั้นทำได้เร็วกว่าเดิม เป็นหลักอาทิตย์หรือหลักเดือน ทาง SubQuery ก็จะช่วยประหยัดเวลาให้กับนักพัฒนา ทำให้ Moonbeam นั้นไม่ต้องเสียเวลาไปพัฒนาในส่วนของ indexer หรือข้อมูลต่างๆทำให้ lauch ออกมาได้อย่างรวดเร็วและประสบความสำเร็จ

## SubQuery จะเข้าร่วม Parachain Auction ไหม?

ณ ปัจจุบัน จะยังไม่ไปในระดับ Parachain ทาง SubQuery จะเป็นในลักษณะที่ deploy ใน Acala การที่ทำแบบนี้ทำให้มีประโยชน์ คือ

1. ประหยัดเวลาและเข้าถึงตลาดได้ไวกว่า
2. ไม่ต้องมาเสียเวลาในการประมูลหรือ ทำ paravote ตอนไหน
3. ทาง SubQuery สามารถลุยเรื่องการใช้งานได้เลย

แต่ในระยะยาวทาง SubQuery ก็จะมี plan ที่จะ launch parachain ของตัวเองเพื่อให้รองรับข้อจำกัดหลายๆอย่างเช่น ค่า fees

การที่ SubQuery deploy ลงใน Acala ไม่ได้แปลว่าจะไม่สามารถ Query ข้อมูลจาก chain อื่นๆไม่ได้  แค่เราทำการ run smart contact บน Acala ก็สามารถทำให้เรา Query ข้อมูลจาก parachain ต่างๆ รวมถึง Avalanche ได้ และจะมีการประมูล parachain เกิดขึ้นแน่นอน แต่อาจจะยังไม่ใช่เร็วๆนี้เพราะตอนนี้ทาง Subquery ได้โฟกัสไปในส่วนของการ Launch ก่อน

## Proof of Indexing คืออะไรและทำงานยังไง?

จุดประสงค์ของการ  Proof คือการยืนยันข้อมูล เราจะแน่ใจได้ยังไงว่า indexer ไม่ได้ทำการ make ข้อมูลขึ้นมา แต่ทาง SubQuery จะทำการยืนยันให้ได้ว่าทาง indexer ไม่ได้โกงโดนผ่านฟังชั่นที่เรียกว่า Hash

Hash เป็นเหมือนฟังชั่นที่จะแปลงข้อมูลนึงเป็นในชุดของตัวเลข สมมุติว่า เรามีข้อมูล A B C D Indexer จะต้องทำการ Hash ให้ได้ตัวเลขชุดนึงและในขณะเดียวกันถ้า Indexer ไม่ได้โกง Indexer จะต้องมี Hash ตรงกับ Indexer คนอื่นๆด้วย ถ้าคนในมี Hash ไม่ตรง หมายความว่าข้อมูลไม่ถูกต้อง และ ข้อมูลของ Indexer คนนั้นจะไม่ถูกนำมาใช้งาน

สรุปได้ว่า Proof of Indexing เป็นการยืนยันข้อมูลบนแต่ละ Index โดยการยืนยันจากการเช็ค Hash ว่าตรงกันไหม

## สามารถเข้าร่วมเป็น Indexer ได้ยังไง?

ในส่วนของการ testnet ที่กำลังจะเปิดในเร็วๆนี้จะมีคนที่ได้ลองเพียงไม่กี่คนเป็นแค่กลุ่มเล็กๆเพื่อเช็คดูว่าระบบเป็นไปได้อย่างราบรื่นไหมหรือมี Bug อะไรเกิดขึ้น แต่พอจบ Season 1 ได้ 1-2 อาทิตย์ทาง SubQuery ก็จะทำการเปิด Season 2 ของ Indexer เพื่อหา bug อีก แต่ใน Season 3-4 จะเปิดโอกาสให้คนทั่วไปได้มีโอกาสเข้าไปลองใช้งานดูได้

## Dev ไม่เป็น สามารถช่วย Contribute ให้ทาง SubQuery ในลักษณะอื่นได้ไหม?

ใน Subquery จะมีหลายงานให้ทำโดยไม่จำเป็นว่าต้องเป็น Developer สามารถติดตามใน Discord ได้จะมีงาน Artwork หรือ media ให้ช่วย Contribute ให้กับทาง SubQuery แล้วก็จะมีในส่วนของ Translation ที่สามารถช่วยทำได้ และในช่วงที่ใกล้กับ TGE ก็จะมีงานมาเยอะขึ้นเพราะในช่วงนั้น จะต้องการการ Contribute ที่มากขึ้น

## จะมีการรับ Spartan กับ Ambassador เพิ่มอีกไหม?

มี ณ ปัจจุบันตัวเลขของ Ambassador ค่อนข้างเยอะ ประมาณ 80 คน แต่ทาง SubQuery อยากจะเพิ่มให้ได้ถึง 100 คนเป็นกลุ่มคนเล็กๆที่ทำงานเพื่อโปรเจคต์อย่างหนัก ซึ่งจะมีการแข่งขันที่สูง แต่การเป็น Spartan ยังเปิดรับเเรื่อยๆ จะมีการรับเพิ่มประมาณ 100-200 คนทุกๆเดือน ซึ่งปัจจุบันมีอยู่ 1000 คน โดยในส่วนการเข้าร่วมเพื่อเป็น Spartan เราสามารถมาทำ Monthly Quest ของทาง SubQuery ได้โดยถ้าเราทำได้ดี เราจะได้ promote เป็น Spartan ได้ หรือถ้าคุณทำออกมาได้ดีจริงๆ ทำเยอะกว่าคนอื่น ก็อาจจะถูก promte เพื่อได้ตำแหน่งที่สูงขึ้นได้

## SubQuery จะเปิดตัวเหรียญ SQT ในช่วงไหนและมีการใช้งานยังไง?

SQT token จะเป็นเสมือนน้ำมันให้กับตัว Network เหมือนกัน Ethereum ที่มีเหรียญ Ether และเป็นเหมือนกับรายได้ให้กับ Indexer ที่คอยรันหรือ Query data ในขณะเดียวกันผู้ใช้งานที่มาใช้งาน Indexer ก็จะได้จ่ายค่าจ้างเป็นเหรียญ SQT และสามารถ delegrate เหรียญ SQT ในกับ Indexer ได้

ในเรื่อง TGE ณ ตอนนี้อาจจะยังตัดสินใจได้ยากเพราะต้องผ่าน testnet ทั้ง 2 season ไปอย่างราบรื่นก่อน เพื่อให้มั่นใจว่าไม่มี bug และใช้งานได้ไม่ขัดข้อง จึงจะเริ่ม TGE
